document_name_accent: viem bang quang o nu gioi.json
document_title: Cystitis in women: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_name: viem-bang-quang-o-nu-gioi.json_3_Signs and symptoms of cystitis in women
subsection_content:
Cystitis in women causes uncomfortable cramps in the lower abdomen, often accompanied by difficulty urinating, frequent urination, and painful urination.
Common symptoms include:
There is a burning sensation when urinating; Pain in the lower abdomen above the pubic bone; Frequent urination; Feeling of incomplete urination; Urine has a foul smell, is cloudy, dark or contains blood; Other symptoms: fever and nausea are uncommon
Cystitis in women is not a dangerous disease. The treatment method is also relatively simple, but has potential serious complications. You need to monitor the signs and symptoms of the disease for early detection and treatment. You can proactively treat it with antibiotics at home, but if the symptoms still do not reduce, you need to see a doctor to receive the correct treatment.
See also: Acute cystitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
